article.headline: Lamar 91, Northwestern St. 82
article.story: NATCHITOCHES, La. (AP) -- Kenny Dawkins had 18 points, nine assists, five rebounds and three steals as Lamar beat Northwestern State 91-82 on Saturday. The game had eight lead changes and six ties, and the Demons trailed only 50-47 at halftime. But the Cardinals took command with an 18-2 run to make the score 70-57 with 14:04 to go, and NSU never got closer than 3 points after that. Matthew Barrow scored seven of his 13 points in that run. He also had seven rebounds for Lamar (10-8, 4-1 Southland). Darren Hopkins and Jay Brown each had 15 points for Lamar. Hopkins pulled down seven rebounds, and Brown had five. Trey Gilder led the Demons (7-13, 3-3) with 24 points, including eight of nine free throws, and seven rebounds. Colby Bargeman added 17 points and five rebounds; Keithan Hankcock had 10 points. Lamar shot 52 percent from the floor after halftime while clamping down on Northwestern, which made 63 percent of its first-half tries but only 40 percent in the second half. The Cardinals also outrebounded NSU 42-29.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
